Body:
Team,

We are trying out this IOT remote monitoring suite from github. We are trying to first deploy that locally instead of Azure and hence we have followed the document mentioned here https://github.com/Azure/azure-iot-remote-monitoring/blob/master/Docs/local-deployment.md

Also
column9:
we have followed the pre-requisites over here https://github.com/Azure/azure-iot-remote-monitoring/blob/master/Docs/dev-setup.md

We then come over to my developer command prompt (running as admin) but we end up having error:

Get-AzureEnvironment : The 'Get-AzureEnvironment' command was found in the module 'Azure'
column10: but the module could not be loaded. For more	  information
column11: r 'Import-Module Azure'. At	  C:\Users\swagh\Downloads\azure-iot-remote-monitoring-master\azure-iot-re	  -monitoring-master\Common\Deployment\PrepareIoTSample.ps1:14 char:14	  +         if ((Get-AzureEnvironment AzureCloud) -eq $null)	  +              ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~	      + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (Get-AzureEnvironment:String)
column12:
CommandNotFoundException + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CouldNotAutoloadMatchingModule

Get-AzureRMEnvironment : The 'Get-AzureRMEnvironment' command was found in module 'AzureRM'
column13: but the module could not be loaded. For	  more information
column14:
run 'Import-Module AzureRM'.

The modules has been imported successfully but not sure why it fails while building the soln locally. Tried setting the execution policy to bypass
column15:
unrestricted. Also scoped to the current user but its not helping.

We have run out of ideas. Can anyone help please?

"

Body: Please run this command to show azure powershell version `Get-Module -ListAvailable -Name Azure -Refresh`?

According to your error message, it seems you have not install Azure PowerShell correctly.

We can install download Azure PowerShell here. After download azure-powershell.4.2.0.msi completed
column9:
run as administrator.

We can find latest version of Azure powershell here.

We can run this command in Azure PowerShell version 4.2.0:

"

Body: Thank you very much for your prompt response.  I shall try this one out and get back to you
@SandeepWagh How about download this msi file, and install it?  download it from here https://github.com/Azure/azure-powershell/releases/download/v4.2.0-July2017/azure-powershell.4.2.0.msi
@SandeepWagh Can we run powershell as administrator? maybe we can use administrator account to run this command.

Sorry Jason, I am still getting the same error. In fact while trying to import the Azure Rm i get thisImport-Module : File C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\AzureRM\4.2.1\AzureRM.psm1 cannot be	its operation is blocked by software restriction policies, such as those created by using Group Poli	At line:1 char:1	+ Import-Module AzureRM	+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~	    + CategoryInfo          : SecurityError: (:) [Import-Module], PSSecurityException	    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : UnauthorizedAccess,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand
@SandeepWagh Please try to restart your laptop, and run this command again.
that's right..it does not allow me to set any policy.
@SandeepWagh have no permission to set it?
I tried to run the powershell as admin too. But the same errror. Last thing i am trying to do is to uninstall everything and reload the Azure RM and check.
@SandeepWagh please wait few mins, let me do some checking, I will give you update later:)
@SandeepWagh could you please run this command and show the return to me?  command is `$PSVersionTable`  and this command `Get-Module -ListAvailable -Name Azure -Refresh`
You can copy this link to you browse and download it. https://github.com/Azure/azure-powershell/releases/download/v4.2.0-July2017/azure-powershell.4.2.0.msi
Still getting the same error. I have attached the screenshot. Can you please take a further look and advise?
@SandeepWagh Just want to confirm the current situations.		Please feel free to let us know if you need further assistance.
I downloaded the msi file and installed it...and the version now shows the same as you first shown in your screenshot. But I am getting the same error.
@SandeepWagh `Tried setting the execution policy to bypass, unrestricted.`   Do you mean you have try this command `Set-ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned` and it does not work for you?

Azure error

The screenshot for the above error.

"
Sorry..Which UI are you talking about?
Download the file, then install it, I add the link in my answer,please check it. File name is azure-power shell-4.2.0. You can copy that link to you browse then download it
Download this file and double click it to install Azure power shell
Please try to download `azure-powershell.4.2.0.msi` file, and install it via UI.
I downloaded the msi file and installed it...and the version now shows the same as you first shown in your screenshot. But I am getting the same error
Do you mean you have install powershell msi, and now powershell can show the right version?
